verses.verse: (God’s Covenant with David) A Maskil of Ethan the Ezrahite. (Ps 101.1) I will sing of your steadfast love, O LORD, (Gk: Heb the steadfast love of the LORD) forever; with my mouth I will proclaim your faithfulness to all generations.
(Ps 103.17) I declare that your steadfast love is established forever; your faithfulness is as firm as the heavens.
(1 Kings 8.16; Ps 132.11) You said, “I have made a covenant with my chosen one; I have sworn to my servant David:
(2 Sam 7.16; Lk 1.33) ‘I will establish your descendants forever and build your throne for all generations.’ ” Selah
(Ps 19.1; 149.1) Let the heavens praise your wonders, O LORD, your faithfulness in the assembly of the holy ones.
(Ps 29.1; Mic 7.18) For who in the skies can be compared to the LORD? Who among the heavenly beings is like the LORD,
(Ps 47.2; 96.4) a God feared in the council of the holy ones, great and awesome (Gk Syr: Heb greatly awesome) above all who are around him?
(Ps 71.19) O LORD God of hosts, who is as mighty as you, O LORD? Your faithfulness surrounds you.
(Ps 65.7) You rule the raging of the sea; when its waves rise, you still them.
(Ps 68.1; Isa 51.9) You crushed Rahab like a carcass; you scattered your enemies with your mighty arm.
(1 Chr 29.11; Ps 24.1, 2) The heavens are yours; the earth also is yours; the world and all that is in it—you founded them.
(Josh 19.22) The north and the south (Or Zaphon and Yamin) —you created them; Tabor and Hermon joyously praise your name.
(Ps 98.1) You have a mighty arm; strong is your hand, high your right hand.
(Ps 85.13; 97.2) Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne; steadfast love and faithfulness go before you.
(Num 10.10) Happy are the people who know the festal shout, who walk, O LORD, in the light of your countenance;
they exult in your name all day long and extol (Cn: Heb are exalted in) your righteousness.
(Ps 28.8; 75.10) For you are the glory of their strength; by your favor our horn is exalted.
(Ps 47.9; 71.22) For our shield belongs to the LORD, our king to the Holy One of Israel.
(1 Kings 11.34) Then you spoke in a vision to your faithful one and said, “I have set the crown (Cn: Heb help) on one who is mighty; I have exalted one chosen from the people.
(1 Sam 16.1, 12; Acts 13.22) I have found my servant David; with my holy oil I have anointed him;
my hand shall always remain with him; my arm also shall strengthen him.
(2 Sam 7.10) The enemy shall not outwit him; the wicked shall not humble him.
(2 Sam 7.9) I will crush his foes before him and strike down those who hate him.
(2 Sam 7.15) My faithfulness and steadfast love shall be with him, and in my name his horn shall be exalted.
I will set his hand on the sea and his right hand on the rivers.
(2 Sam 7.14) He shall cry to me, ‘You are my Father, my God, and the Rock of my salvation!’
(Num 24.7; Col 1.15; Rev 1.5) I will make him the firstborn, the highest of the kings of the earth.
(Isa 55.3) Forever I will keep my steadfast love for him, and my covenant with him will stand firm.
(Deut 11.21; Isa 9.7; Jer 33.17) I will establish his line forever and his throne as long as the heavens endure.
(2 Sam 7.14) If his children forsake my law and do not walk according to my ordinances,
if they violate my statutes and do not keep my commandments,
(2 Sam 7.14) then I will punish their transgression with the rod and their iniquity with scourges,
(2 Sam 7.15) but I will not remove from him my steadfast love or be false to my faithfulness.
(Num 23.19; Deut 7.9) I will not violate my covenant or alter the word that went forth from my lips.
(Am 4.2) Once and for all I have sworn by my holiness; I will not lie to David.
(Ps 72.5) His line shall continue forever, and his throne endure before me like the sun.
It shall be established forever like the moon, an enduring witness in the skies.” Selah
(Deut 32.19; 1 Chr 28.9) But now you have spurned and rejected him; you are full of wrath against your anointed.
(Lam 5.16) You have renounced the covenant with your servant; you have defiled his crown in the dust.
(Ps 80.12; Lam 2.2, 5) You have broken through all his walls; you have laid his strongholds in ruins.
(Ps 44.13) All who pass by plunder him; he has become the scorn of his neighbors.
(Ps 13.2; 80.6) You have exalted the right hand of his foes; you have made all his enemies rejoice.
(Ps 44.10) Moreover, you have turned back the edge of his sword, and you have not supported him in battle.
(Ezek 28.7) You have removed the scepter from his hand (Cn: Heb removed his cleanness) and hurled his throne to the ground.
(Ps 44.15; 102.23) You have cut short the days of his youth; you have covered him with shame. Selah
(Ps 79.5) How long, O LORD? Will you hide yourself forever? How long will your wrath burn like fire?
(Job 7.7; 10.9; 14.1; Ps 39.5) Remember how short my time is— (Meaning of Heb uncertain) for what vanity you have created all mortals!
(Ps 49.9; Heb 11.5) Who can live and never see death? Who can escape the power of Sheol? Selah
(2 Sam 7.15; Ps 54.5) Lord, where is your steadfast love of old, which by your faithfulness you swore to David?
(Ps 69.9, 19) Remember, O Lord, how your servant is taunted, how I bear in my bosom the insults of the peoples, (Cn: Heb bosom all of many peoples)
(Ps 74.10) with which your enemies taunt, O LORD, with which they taunted the footsteps of your anointed.
(Ps 41.13) Blessed be the LORD forever. Amen and Amen.
